alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Rice (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 8:28PM CDT until April 07 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Minnesota... Cannon River AT Northfield affecting Dakota and Rice Counties. .Melting snow combined with precipitation that fell a couple of days ago has led to an increase in river levels. With another system arriving in a couple of days, further rises to the levels are expected, with flood stage being exceeded by Monday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cannon River AT Northfield. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 897.5 feet, Flood waters reach Carleton College soccer fields. Babcock Park north of downtown begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM CDT Sunday, the stage was 896.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 898.0 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 897.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 898.1 feet on 10/06/2019. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
